channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Volkswagen abandonne ses technologies maison : le plan de la dernière chance face à BYD en Chine
item.description: Face à l'effondrement de ses ventes sur le marché chinois, Volkswagen met de côté ce que l'on connaît en Europe et confie l'architecture de toutes ses voitures électriques et hybrides vendues en Chine au constructeur chinois Xpeng d'ici 2030.

item.title: Cet écran MSI en Full HD avec une fente intégrée pour ranger ses câbles perd 40 % de son prix chez Darty
item.description: Le MSI PRO MP2412 coche toutes les cases attendues de la part d'un écran PC avec sa dalle Full HD de 23,8 pouces, mais il ne s'affirme pas comme une référence dans le domaine. Pour seulement 59,99 euros au lieu de 99,99 euros chez Darty, on n'en demande pas davantage.

item.title: Jobs, activités, histoire, fonctionnalités : tout ce que contient la version d’essai de Final Fantasy 14 [Sponso]
item.description: Saviez-vous que l’un des RPG en ligne les plus marquants de ces quinze dernières années était (presque) gratuit ? Avec sa version d’essai gargantuesque, Final Fantasy 14 vous permet de découvrir son univers sans débourser un centime.

item.title: Une simple couche de gel pourrait régler le plus gros problème des panneaux solaires
item.description: Les recherches se poursuivent pour améliorer les technologies d’énergie renouvelable. Du côté du solaire, des scientifiques ont mis au point un revêtement innovant capable de refroidir les panneaux et ainsi d’augmenter leur production.

item.title: Spotify now lets you swipe on songs to learn more about them
item.description: Spotify is rolling out a feature called About the Song which lets fans learn a bit more about their favorite tunes. This "brings stories and context" into the listening experience, sort of like that old VH1 show Pop Up Video. How does it work? The Now Playing View houses short, swipeable story cards that "explore the meaning" behind the music. This information is sourced from third parties and the company promises "interesting details and behind-the-scenes moments." All you have to do is scroll down until you see the card and then swipe. This is rolling out right now to Premium users on both i...

item.title: Conduent data breach might have been much worse than initially expected
item.description: Tens of millions of people are most likely affected by the January 2025 Conduent breach.

item.title: These cheap DualSense accessories are a fixture of my PS5 setup and prove you don't have to throw money around to improve your game
item.description: I can't remember the last time I used a DualSense controller without these cheap PS5 accessories

item.title: The Kindle Scribe Colorsoft is a pricey but pretty e-ink color tablet with AI features
item.description: The price point hurts, but the device is nice: Meet the Kindle Scribe Colorsoft.

item.title: Get a four-pack of first-gen AirTags for only $64
item.description:
Good deals on Apple products aren’t as frequent as we’d like them to be, but if there’s one of the company’s products that does seem to enjoy pretty regular price cuts, it’s the AirTag. Right now you can pick up a four-pack of Apple’s diminutive first-generation Bluetooth trackers for $64, which translates to 35 percent off and a near record low price.
Bear in mind that this deal brings the price per AirTag down to about $16 if you were to buy them individually, and when not on sale they usually cost $29. The single first-gen AirTags are also on sale right now, and you can pick one up for 41...

item.title: The Only Thing Standing Between Humanity and AI Apocalypse Is … Claude?
item.description: As AI systems grow more powerful, Anthropic’s resident philosopher says the startup is betting Claude itself can learn the wisdom needed to avoid disaster.

item.title: Iguanas Fell From Trees During Florida Cold Snap—and the Numbers Are Staggering
item.description: Government and private pest control services have collected roughly 8,000 frozen iguanas from across the state.

item.title: Flickr est victime d’une fuite de données
item.description: Flickr a été victime d’une fuite de données chez l’un de ses prestataires. En exploitant une vulnérabilité dans l’outil de messagerie, un tiers a pu consulter des données personnelles sur les clients de la plateforme.

item.title: EU says TikTok must disable ‘addictive’ features like infinite scroll, fix its recommendation engine
item.description: The European Commission on Friday accused TikTok of purposefully designing its app for being "addictive," calling out features such as infinite scroll, autoplay, push notifications, and its recommendation engine.

item.title: The Alexa app is so bad I’m using Siri again
item.description: I've used Alexa to manage my shopping list for years. There are plenty of great list apps out there, but the convenience of adding items by voice anywhere in my house, pulling up the list on an Echo Show in the kitchen, and having it on my phone via the Alexa app has worked well […]

item.title: EU Says TikTok’s ‘Addictive Design’ Likely Violates the Law, Will Need to Change
item.description: European regulators issued a preliminary finding that the app’s design likely violates the bloc’s laws.

item.title: Top investment platform hit in data breach - over 1.4 million Betterment accounts exposed
item.description: Betterment accounts were not compromised, but users might start getting phishing emails.

item.title: Sur ce site les IA louent des humains pour les faire travailler : le délire de science-fiction est devenue une réalité
item.description: Être payé pour toucher de l’herbe, tenir des pancartes en public, ou tester des restos italiens, ça vous tente ? Sur RentAHuman.ai, c'est possible. La plateforme propose en effet à des IA de louer des humains pour réaliser des tâches dans le monde réel. En échange de leur temps, les personnes louées reçoivent des cryptomonnaies.

item.title: How rising complexity is reshaping the role of data center services
item.description: The capacity to install, integrate, monitor and maintain hardware directly influences long-term performance.

item.title: The Olympics May Have a Penis Problem Thanks to Ski Jumping
item.description: German newspaper BILD reported on the alleged penis-gate last month.

item.title: Réparations illimitées et batterie remplacée : Samsung muscle son assurance pour les Galaxy
item.description: Samsung annonce une évolution de son programme de protection des appareils Galaxy. L’assurance Samsung Care+ devient désormais illimitée pour les utilisateurs européens, mettant fin aux restrictions sur le nombre de réparations couvertes.

item.title: Amazon Prime members are being treated to 21 games in February, including free access to Tiny Tina's Wonderlands and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle: The Order of Giants DLC
item.description: Amazon Luna's monthly freebies for February have been revealed, and included are Indiana Jones and the Great Circle's downloadable content (DLC), The Order of Giants, Alan Wake 2, and more.

item.title: Paul W.S. Anderson Can’t Help But Return to Video Game Zombies
item.description: 'The Last of Us' and 'Superman' actress Isabela Merced is set to star in Anderson's upcoming 'House of the Dead' movie.

item.title: You Couldn’t Afford Nvidia’s Next Gen GPUs, Even if You Wanted Them
item.description: The problem isn’t future graphic card delays; it’s today’s skyrocketing prices.

item.title: More Than 800 Google Workers Urge Company to Cancel Any Contracts With ICE and CBP
item.description: The campaign is among the largest anti-ICE protests by workers at a single company since federal agents shot and killed two people in Minneapolis last month.

item.title: Analogue’s 4K N64 is getting five new transparent color options
item.description: Analogue has announced another collection of limited-edition colors for its modern remake of the Nintendo 64. Last December it introduced several transparent versions of the Analogue 3D inspired by Nintendo's Funtastic N64 series, but this time the company says it drew inspiration from colored versions of the nearly 30-year-old console that Nintendo prototyped, but never […]...

item.title: What happens when Waymo runs into a tornado? Or an elephant?
item.description: An autonomous vehicle drives down a lonely stretch of highway. Suddenly, a massive tornado appears in the distance. What does the driverless vehicle do next? This is just one of the scenarios that Waymo can simulate in the "hyper realistic" virtual world that it has just created with help from Google's DeepMind. Waymo's World Model […]

item.title: I tested Samsung’s outrageously fast 500Hz OLED gaming monitor and it blew my mind – but there’s a huge catch
item.description: Samsung's latest 27-inch 500Hz OLED gaming monitor, the Odyssey OLED G6 G60SF, is incredibly fast, but that does come at a cost.

item.title: Charlie Puth admits he ‘applied’ to sing at the Super Bowl. It shows how one key personality trait fuels success
item.description: The Grammy-nominated star recently told Rolling Stone that he ‘applied’ and ‘auditioned’ to sing Sunday’s national anthem at the big game. Just because you’re an ultra-talented global celebrity doesn’t mean you’re a shoo-in for an amazing gig. In fact, even stars have to apply to jobs, just like the rest of us. Just ask Charlie Puth, who’ll be singing “The Star-Spangled Banner” at Super Bowl LX Sunday night....

item.title: Asus TUF Gaming A18 : RTX 5070, écran QHD+ 240 Hz et 400 € de réduction sur ce monstre de 18 pouces
item.description: L’Asus TUF Gaming A18 s’impose comme une vraie bonne affaire pour les gamers grâce à son écran XXL 18" QHD+ à 240 Hz ultra-fluide et sa RTX 5070 capable de faire tourner les titres récents sans broncher. S'il fallait débourser 2 299 euros pour l'acquérir, aujourd'hui il revient à 1 899 euros.

item.title: Constraints do not limit creativity—they unlock it
item.description: The fastest path to innovation is designing inside real human limits.

item.title: Presidents' Day sales 2026: The best early tech deals from Apple, Sony, Roku and others
item.description: You can find a lot of good deals for Presidents’ Day, but to say it’s a tech-deal boon would be an overstatement. The best Presidents’ Day deals are usually on mattresses, appliances and furniture, but you can find some decent tech sales thrown in as well. This year, Presidents’ Day comes right after Valentine’s Day and Super Bowl 2026, which means there are even more chances to save as sales and discounts overlap. If you’re looking for a new streaming device, a fresh iPad or an upgraded vacuum so you can enter the spring-cleaning season properly, we have you covered. These are the best Presid...

item.title: Design as a catalyst for wellbeing
item.description: How to support holistic health through the end-to-end design process

item.title: Everything you ever wanted to know about the Super Bowl’s confetti blizzard
item.description: Noah Winter, founder of Artistry in Motion, is the man behind the celebratory confetti at the end of the game. Noah Winter brags he’s been to way more Super Bowls than Tom Brady.Brady competed in 10 — more than any other player. But Winter will be part of the Super Bowl spectacle for his 30th straight year this year, not in uniform but as the guy in charge of the celebratory confetti after the game ends.Winter’s company, Artistry in Motion, also makes confetti for rock concerts, movies, political conventions and the Olympics. But the annual blizzard of color falling onto the field at the end o...

item.title: China’s Salt Typhoon hackers broke into Norwegian companies
item.description: Norway's government accused China’s Salt Typhoon hacking group of conducting a cyberespionage campaign in the country.

item.title: Super Bowl 2026 TV deals: The best sales we found this week on OLEDs and other smart TVs ahead of kickoff
item.description: The big game is one of the few instances now in the US where most people gather around the TV to watch the live event together. While the teams playing in Super Bowl 2026 are the true stars of the show (and Bad Bunny, of course), your TV is a pretty important part of the puzzle of putting together an excellent Super Bowl party. Maybe you’ve been thinking about replacing an aging set, or you’re itching for a full refresh of your home theater setup — either way, you’ll want to try to get a good deal on a new TV. Thankfully, the weeks leading up to the Super Bowl can be a great time to shop for a...

item.title: Save Up to $50 on the best entry-level VR headset in the world right now
item.description: The best VR headset for the money just got even cheaper

item.title: Disney+ : l’offre premium perd une grande partie de son intérêt
item.description: Coup dur pour les abonnés européens de Disney+ Premium : depuis plusieurs semaines, la plateforme a discrètement perdu la prise en charge du Dolby Vision et du HDR10+. Un contretemps présenté comme « technique », mais qui cacherait en réalité un litige judiciaire autour de brevets. Résultat : les contenus ne s’affichent plus qu’en simple HDR10, de quoi entamer la promesse haut de gamme du service....

item.title: Find all your lost items with a pack of 2nd Gen Apple AirTags for their best price yet
item.description: As of Feb. 6, get a pack of 2nd Gen Apple AirTags for their best price yet.

item.title: NASA will now allow astronauts to take their smartphones to space
item.description: Most people wouldn't leave their phones behind when they so much as go for a drive, but NASA astronauts have had to leave their phones on Earth while they went to work 250 miles away at the International Space Station. That is, until now. In a post on X, NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman shared that the Crew-12 and Artemis II astronauts will be allowed to bring smartphones along for the journey to the ISS and beyond. "We are giving our crews the tools to capture special moments for their families and share inspiring images and video with the world," Isaacman said. While these won't be the firs...

item.title: All your Hinge questions, answered
item.description: Hinge dating app answers, like how many 'likes' free users can send a day and whether users can change their gender.

item.title: ‘Today’ host Savannah Guthrie is demanding proof of life for her mother. Deepfakes will make that complicated
item.description: Police have not received any deepfake images of Guthrie’s mother. When Savannah Guthrie made a heart-wrenching plea to the kidnapper of her 84-year-old mother to send “proof of life,” she addressed the possibility of people creating deepfakes.“We live in a world where voices and images are easily manipulated,” she said.Before artificial intelligence tools proliferated — making it possible to realistically impersonate someone, in photos, sound and video — “proof of life” could simply mean sending a grainy image of a person who’s been abducted.That’s no longer true.“With AI these days you can ma...

item.title: I ran the London marathon with this Garmin watch, and it's half price right now – just in time for your own training plan
item.description: Get some long spring runs in with this better-than-half-price deal on my favorite Garmin watch ever.

item.title: CISA tells federal agencies to replace at-risk end-of-life edge devices
item.description: CISA has given federal agencies 12 months to remove and replace edge devices which have reached end-of-service.

item.title: People have noticed that TrumpRx looks a lot like GoodRx. There’s a reason for the similarities
item.description: A new prescription discount website from the federal government is using GoodRx as an integration partner, says the company. Will patients be better off? President Trump and the Republican party have worked hard over the years to undermine the Affordable Care Act (ACA), leaving fewer people with access to health insurance.

item.title: How TikTok became the front row to the 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Thanks to relaxed social media rules, athletes are vlogging their travel, training, meals, and downtime straight from the Olympic Village. Friday is the opening ceremony for the 2026 Winter Olympics. But, if you’ve spent any time on TikTok over the past week, you might have already got a sneak peek at some behind-the-scenes content courtesy of the athletes themselves. ...

item.title: More RAM misery? The bad news keeps coming as analyst firm warns of an 'unprecedented and record-breaking surge' with price hikes
item.description: If you thought the RAM crisis was levelling off, think again — the next couple of months could be seriously painful.

item.title: Researchers Asked Drivers to Interpret Cyclist Signals. It Didn’t Go Well
item.description: Participants in a recent study were asked to decode cyclists' hand signals. How well do you think you would've done?

item.description: Les derniers chiffres sur l’évolution du prix de la RAM sont tombés et ils font peur à voir.

item.title: 'With RPGs, it's all about offering players things that they only get to experience in the game' — Sea of Remnants creative director outlines vision behind upcoming free-to-play pirate epic
item.description: I sit down with the product lead of Sea of Remnants to discuss the production of the massive upcoming free-to-play game.

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Drops Another Huge Challenge on Dunk
item.description: In 'Seven,' Westeros' most honorable hedge knight learns the heavy price he'll have to pay for his actions in 'The Squire.'

item.title: AG1 is a lot less science-y than it sounds
item.description: This is Optimizer, a weekly newsletter sent every Friday from Verge senior reviewer Victoria Song that dissects and discusses the latest gizmos and potions that swear they're going to change your life. Optimizer arrives in our subscribers' inboxes at 10AM ET. Opt in for Optimizer here. I'm willing to bet you've been served an ad […]

item.title: "Weirder than Bill Gates and Steve Wozniak put together": Japan's answer to Steve Jobs predicted personified computers, smartphones and AI in 1984 through a sixth sense, viewing the world as a dog or a dolphin
item.description: In 1984, Sunao Takatori used his sixth sense to imagine a vision of computing that feels strikingly familiar today.

item.title: L’iPhone 18 Pro Max s’annonce déjà comme un monstre d’autonomie (et de poids)
item.description: C’est une barrière symbolique qu’Apple s’est longtemps refusée à franchir, préférant miser sur l'optimisation logicielle plutôt que sur la force brute. Mais selon une fuite jugée crédible, l’iPhone 18 Pro Max pourrait enfin dépasser le cap des 5 000 mAh, promettant une endurance record pour la cuvée 2026.

item.title: How to watch Frontline: Our Soldiers Facing Putin online from anywhere — it's *FREE*
item.description: Want to witness the frontline realities behind NATO’s preparations against Putin? Here's how to watch Frontline: Our Soldiers Facing Putin for FREE.

item.title: Apple's iPhone Air MagSafe battery drops to an all-time-low price
item.description:
We found the iPhone Air to have a pretty decent battery life for such a thin-and-light phone, somewhere in the region of 27 hours if you’re continuously streaming video. But it's still a phone, arguably your most used device on a daily basis, so you may need to top it up during the day if you're using it constantly. That’s where Apple’s iPhone Air MagSafe battery pack comes in, and it’s currently on sale for $79.
This accessory only works with the iPhone Air, but much like the phone it attaches to, it’s extremely slim at 7.5mmm, so crucially doesn’t add so much bulk when attached that it def...

item.title: 'It's a marathon, not a sprint' – VPN Trust Initiative cracks down on complacency with new annual audit rules
item.description: The VPN Trust Initiative is updating its seal of approval. To keep the VPN Trust Seal badge, VPNs now have to prove they are secure, private, and ethical every single year.

item.title: These are the VPNs you’ll want to consider for Super Bowl weekend
item.description: We've tested and ranked today's top VPNs to help you find the best option for the upcoming Super Bowl LX.

item.title: Des résultats « exceptionnels » : les puces Ryzen génèrent désormais des revenus colossaux pour AMD
item.description: Son dernier bilan financier le confirme, AMD gagne désormais beaucoup d'argent grâce aux ventes soutenues de ses processeurs Ryzen. Une performance commerciale que Lisa Su décrit d'ailleurs comme « exceptionnelle », tout bonnement.

item.title: « Fortnite, cool… c’est pas ça la vie » : Emmanuel Macron relance un vieux procès fait aux jeux vidéo
item.description: Emmanuel Macron va confier à des experts une nouvelle étude sur l'impact des jeux vidéo sur les joueurs et notamment les plus jeunes. Il s'agit de « mesurer scientifiquement » leur effet avant de prendre, le cas échéant, de nouvelles mesures. Une annonce qui fait froid dans le dos de toute l'industrie, qui célèbre toujours le succès du jeu français Clair Obscur: Expedition 33....
